author: Special Correspondent
text:
Personnel of the flying squad attached to Salem North Assembly constituency preferred a complaint with the Salem town police station on Monday against Social Welfare Minister B. Valarmathi for poll code violation.

R. Rajendran, secretary of the Salem Central District unit of the DMK, handed over a petition to C. Vijay Babu, Revenue Divisional Officer, and Returning Officer of the constituency, recently stating that Ms. Valarmathi, addressing a public meeting in the city on March 17, had made derogatory remarks against DMK chief M. Karunanidhi, party treasurer M.K. Stalin and Raja Sabha member M.K. Kanimozhi, in violation of the Model Code of Conduct. He had sought action against the Minister.

Mr. Rajendran also handed over a CD containing the Minister’s speech to substantiate his claim.

Mr. Vijay Babu handed over the CD to a three-member Video Viewing Team attached to Salem North Assembly Constituency, seeking a report. The team submitted its report on March 25.
title: Poll code violation complaint filed against Valarmathi
